body_html:
Hello @harry67yqh,

I may have the same issue than you. I can easily run squeezenet tutorial with Caffe2's Python API and load both init_net.pb and predict_net.pb. However, I need to use Caffe2 in a C++ program and I need to load those pb files using Caffe2's C++ API.

After using the function NetBase* CreateNet(const NetDef& net_def, bool overwrite = false);, I get this error :

"E1031 12:02:37.024430 4164 workspace.cc:243] Error when creating the network.Maybe net type: [] does not exist"

But I have no problem when creating it using Caffe2's Python API.

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2

  • How do you installed Caffe2 (conda, pip, source): source

  • OS: Windows 10 professional

  • Caffe2 version: from master branch, begining of October 2018

  • Python version: 2.7.14

  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.1

  • GPU models and configuration: GTX1050Ti

  • CMake version: 3.12.3

  • Protobuf version : the one coming with git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git

Did you find a solution to your problem?

Olivier

body:
Hello @harry67yqh,

I may have the same issue than you. I can easily run squeezenet tutorial with Caffe2's Python API and load both init_net.pb and predict_net.pb. However, I need to use Caffe2 in a C++ program and I need to load those pb files using Caffe2's C++ API.

After using the function `NetBase* CreateNet(const NetDef& net_def, bool overwrite = false);`, I get this error :

**"E1031 12:02:37.024430  4164 workspace.cc:243] Error when creating the network.Maybe net type: [] does not exist"**

But I have no problem when creating it using Caffe2's Python API.

**System Info**

- PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2

- How do you installed Caffe2 (conda, pip, source): source

- OS: Windows 10 professional

- Caffe2 version: from master branch, begining of October 2018

- Python version: 2.7.14

- CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.1

- GPU models and configuration: GTX1050Ti

- CMake version: 3.12.3

- Protobuf version : the one coming with `git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git`


Did you find a solution to your problem?

Olivier
